avail.title: 4th Revised Ultimate History of Network Radio Programming and Guide to ALL Circulating Shows, The
avail.author: Hickerson, Jay

infos.info: In his book, Music Radio, Jim Cox writes that Carnival of Musical Contrasts is an alternate name for this program.
This show is a reappearance of the Jack Pearl Show which aired from 1932 to 1937.

1935 Jack Pearl program called: Peter Pfeiffer; - 1936-39 program called: The Raleigh-Kool Program. Jack Pearl left the show in 1937, and it continued until Sept. 30,1939, by Tommy Dorsey. - Jack Pearl's 1948 show called: Jack and Cliff the 1953 program was a quiz show called: The Baron and the Bee.
Summer replacement for: Fibber McGee and Molly
Also known as Baron (von) Munchhausen, according to Dunning, other show names were: - 2/13/35-5/22/35 - Peter Pfeiffer - 11/9/36-6/25/37 - Raleigh-Kool Program - 6/9/48-9/15/48 - Jack and Cliff

synopses.synopsis: A comedy/variety program appearing only in the summer of 1948. This program was hosted by Jack Pearl and Cliff Hall and featured comedy sketches centering around Pearl's famous character, Baron Munchausen.

themes.theme: Happy Days Are Here Again', 'Two Cigarettes in the Dark'
